website_summaries.verdict: Not only do these lifters have a memory foam insert that keeps your furniture in place, but their low profile looks fantastic.
pros: Raises stationary furniture 2 inches with a collective weight capacity of 2,000 pounds (500 pounds per lift)
The recessed cup also features a memory foam insert to ensure your furniture legs or caster wheels are securely locked in place
cons: The bottom grips that make contact with the floor can come out if shifted under load, and become easily lost

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these. Cheap plastic breaks under pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Broke less than 2 weeks after receiving product. Went to sit down on the couch and the legs broke right through this plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is.
customer_reviews.text: The product is what it is: 2 inch risers. It was our fault that the 2 inch lift, these risers are built to give, for our desk turned out to be about a 1/2 inch too high so we fixed it by turning the risers upside down. Presto ! desk now level with the other table. Why did we still only give 3 stars?? because the risers are very light weight and the table would shift and slide when on them (even when right side up). Maybe a heavier table or desk would have held it all in place better? but I'm writing on our experience so others can take this into consideration.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Risers wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy exactly what I need it as I have a bed that is adjustable and also massages the cups are sturdy and the wheels fit into then perfectly and the tough foam cushioning inside the cups helps to keep it in place plus they arrived very quickly
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit beter than expected
customer_reviews.text: At first I was concerned the sofa legs would fit on the Risers, but they had room to spare. The top inside of the risers have a foam pad too keep the legs from sliding around, a very nice touch. Installing is just a mater of lifting the sofa and sliding a riser under each leg. Having two more inches of height on the sofa makes it much easier to get up.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I returned them. After less than a week, they started to show signs of perforations. My daughter and granddaughter slept in the twin beds. My daughter weighs about 130lbs and granddaughter about 40lbs. Would definitely not hold up for future visits or any other company.
customer_reviews.author: TEETHVA

customer_reviews.title: As I'd hoped!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use with an electric lift recliner that was too low to the floor for me to transfer to & from my electric wheelchair comfortably. They work perfectly, I'm very happy with them..
customer_reviews.author: nobleday

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: The sponge-y part on top that supposedly helps it not move around, actually contributes to instability. We tried several tables, but because of the squishy nature, it actually causes table legs to want to 'bow'. It's really a strange piece of crap. I bought this to use with a dining room table but it just isn't going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Product description states each piece is capable of supporting 500 ...
customer_reviews.text: Product description states each piece is capable of supporting 500 pounds, giving you a total of 2000 pounds of weight bearing tolerance. However on the package label, it states each piece is only capable of supporting 255 pounds. Also the grippers are tiny little pieces of clear plastic about the size of a pinhead, and there are four of them. Not as described, going back.
customer_reviews.author: R. Loverso

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Design
customer_reviews.text: Theys eem very cheap and flimsy plastic. They slide alot as they are a smooth plastic. They seem like hardened red solo cups, i definitely don't recommend them. One cracked as i used it and the object was well below the weeight limit
customer_reviews.author: veritech_13Top Contributor: Boxing

customer_reviews.title: Work very well
customer_reviews.text: We have an antique table that was on rolling casters. This didn't work well for our little kids who pushed the table around all the time and it was hard on our hardwood floors. But without the casters the table was too low. We put these risers underneath the table and it keeps the old rickety table very steady and at exactly the right height. They never move even though our young family is hard on our table!
customer_reviews.author: Stapayr8485

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.  No longer feel we need to throw out our 3 piece sectional
customer_reviews.text: They aren't beautiful but they sure do work. We have a large sectional leather couch and its gotten harder to get back up once we sit down and sink into the cushions. These risers have done wonders. Our knees and hips are no longer so far above our rears and we can get up easily. Only took the 2 inch size. We tried out enough for just one section first. in case we needed more height. Very happy. There are other styles, wooden etc, we could change to something more luxurious and thought we probably would, however the joy of being happy with a couch that is more usable again has removed our urgency for now. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Instant satisfaction - Instant difference - Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Best purchase for my elderly mother. My mom has a bad knee and a bad back, and was having trouble getting up and down out of her chair. These worked amazing!! It took less than 5 minutes. We put these under her chair, and instantly she noticed a huge difference, and was able to get up out of her chair, which she had struggled with, prior to these. Also, these support a large weight, my mother is 250, and these work amazing!! Thank you to the inventor of these!! Great quality purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Az Mom of Five

customer_reviews.title: Good for lifting beds!
customer_reviews.text: Got this because I needed to add only two inches to my bed in order to fit my new roll-under clothes storage dresser, but I was only able to find 6 inch lifts in stores. I didn't want to have to climb my way up into my own bed, I just needed two extra inches, so I just looked online and bought these! I bought them 6 months ago and they appear to still be holding up well being under my bed.
customer_reviews.author: Tiana Nicole Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for the outer bed posts!
customer_reviews.text: Unlike those square bed risers with sharp corners, these round bed risers are much less likely to hurt your toes when you run into them. These also come with the cushion top that supports the post really well without sliding around. Great value for the price too. I highly recommend this set.
customer_reviews.author: Mifavoritethings

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fitting things under a tall bed!
customer_reviews.text: Had a set of 6” risers that I couldn’t use because my memory foam mattress topper already made the bed a bit high. Found these 2” risers and celebrated! Now I can fit all my under-the-bed boxes without any struggle!! Great idea! Delivered as expected and a value that is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Rainy Smyth

customer_reviews.title: Much bigger and bulkier than expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this thinking it would be small, unnoticeable and a nice attachment to lift my bed. I was wrong. It's huge, the color is actually a brownish tone, not black and it looks silly. I am returning it and will look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ihaiah Miller

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: The 2 inch lift was the perfect amount to raise my son’s bed to allow for storage underneath. However, after only two weeks one lift cracked and the bed “leg” broke through, so it was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: S. Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Elevates your bed with ease! Take advantage of increased storage space under your bed.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to elevate my entire bed by a few inches. I store extra purses in an "underbed box" but the lid catches under my normal height bed frame. I simply inserted one under each foot, and now it's higher and my underbed box is actually easy to maneuver in and out. We've only used them for a week so I cannot speak to durability, but they are holding up so far. We have a standard metal frame and king sized box springs and mattress.
customer_reviews.author: GiniK

customer_reviews.title: Careful when you think about how much room you need!
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today. I didn't want to add more height than this as it would make the bed look odd to me. I ordered these because of the height, but did not take into account the thickness of the frame. While they work and do what they are supposed to do, they are slightly shorter than what I would have hoped for. That isn't the product's fault, but mine. They seem more sturdy when they are in hand and seem like they will hold up very well overall.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but could he better.
customer_reviews.text: These are okay. They are cheap looking so I’m not sure if I want them visible under my couch. I bought them so my robotic vacuum can get under the chair. My biggest complaint is they slide around on my hardwood floors. I wish they had rubber on the bottom so the chair doesn’t move when you get in and out of it (it’s a large armchair, did not previously move)
customer_reviews.author: Laura Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Great item with great value
customer_reviews.text: Our couch was just not comfortable because it was too low. These risers are the perfect height. Putting these under our couch did not change the sturdiness of the couch at all, but the furniture is higher and more comfortable to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: Kaylie

customer_reviews.title: Lifts
customer_reviews.text: After a month they are dented in the middle. And we’re only using at foot of bed where there is less weight. The bed is lightweight too. We have four so after these two wear out we can add the the other two. Good value. Right height
customer_reviews.author: S. Guy

customer_reviews.title: I used this to raise the height of a standard ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to raise the height of a standard desk since I am tall and I wanted to use normal monitor risers and make the built in keyboard tray at the correct height. The risers have a dense foam as the top layer so the legs sink into that and they don't slide around.
customer_reviews.author: lildutchblonde

customer_reviews.title: Cushin Me Baby
customer_reviews.text: Though well made in material for the support of me; 198lbs + about 100lbs for the box spring and mattress and bed frame, the cushin seen in the photo could have been made of better material. But I do still recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo S

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Two inches is just about right you want to raise your recliner. Three inches is too much in my opinion. Product color blends in nicely, truly non slippery surface an issue I was having with my recliner for several years.
customer_reviews.author: Matt 190

customer_reviews.title: Not too tall!
customer_reviews.text: Because of space limitations I needed to overlap 2 6ft lifetime tables in a corner. The lift was perfect to raise one table enough to set it on top of the other table. Sturdy, no wobble and the perfect amount of lift
customer_reviews.author: Babs H

customer_reviews.title: Grips  come out easily
customer_reviews.text: Height is great, but the tiny grips don't stay in the holes very well... if the furniture moves or is moved, the clear grips come out and are easily lost and hard to find to put back in... we put these on our sectional and the ottoman and the clear grips are completely gone on the ottoman so it just slides around on the hardwood floor... I'll have to get some grips from my local hardware store...
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Raised desk to fit chair
customer_reviews.text: Working from home my husband had to upgrade his computer chair, but the new one would not fit under his desk (arms were just too high). We bought these to raise the desk and they've worked perfectly with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Finn

customer_reviews.title: I will love them forever
customer_reviews.text: If they don't end up breaking, I will love them forever! They lifted a very low patio table to the necessary height! Now I don't feel like a giant at the table! Only have had them a week, but they are perfect and the color is perfect to match the bronze legs!! So you can barely tell they are there!! Happy I was able to find such an obscure item!! Thank you Slipstick!!
customer_reviews.author: Cory DeNuccio

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in a wheelchair and I couldn't get under my desk to work. I happened upon these lifts and thought I'd give them a try. They raise my desk to a perfect height and I can roll right under and do my work. They've been a life changer!
customer_reviews.author: Grammasami

customer_reviews.title: Functional but ugly
customer_reviews.text: They are totally functional, and I like the foamy part on the top of the riser so that any furniture leg will fit in snugly. However they are pretty ugly - just look like plastic buckets. I think they are a good value and would recommend if you will be using them in a non-visible way, like under a bedskirt.
customer_reviews.author: S. Atkins

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We used these to raise a four post cast iron queen size canopy bed so we could put rolling storage drawers underneath the bed. The bed was really heavy so I used my car jack to raise each corner to install, definitely saved stress on my back and arms.
customer_reviews.author: James F.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: We took the floor board off our colonial bed and put a regular frame on it which lowered the height so we could not fit our under the bed boxes underneath. These raised the bed just enough but not too high so we could put the boxes underneath. Perfect for what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: music mom

customer_reviews.title: Works great for basement tabel
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to rase up my folding tabel in my basement 1 to proven ferther damages to the ends of the feet and 2 becuse using it at its original hight hirt my back this works great now have to find sturdyer ones for sofa sleeper and upstairs sofa
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Got pets and need a little height and they can still jump up, this is it!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to put my crochet in underbed rolling containers under my bed, but 2 inches is too high for my little dogs to jump. These 1 inche were perfect. Spongy in the middle and is sturdy. good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Product details.
customer_reviews.text: I received these today and the first thing I noticed is the package says supports 500 lbs not 2000 as the details claim. I will change my rating if I find they are great or if they are poor quality. I don’t appreciate misleading details.
customer_reviews.author: Mychelle R.

customer_reviews.title: So much better now
customer_reviews.text: We recently bought a couch, and upon sitting on it we had realized...it felt like we were sitting on the floor. That's how close it was to the ground. But after buying these, our couch finally feels like a comfortable lounging couch, rather than a beanbag chair. (:
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: NOT 2" AS ADVERTISED!!!
customer_reviews.text: NOT 2" AS ADVERTISED!!! These are 3 1/8 inches tall. They will be going back.
customer_reviews.author: MsRR

customer_reviews.title: I almost ordered 3 thinking I needed more for my couch but 2" was perfect. I'm short and my cushions on my couch ...
customer_reviews.text: This was just what I needed, if you think you need 3" you might want to try the 2" first. I almost ordered 3 thinking I needed more for my couch but 2" was perfect. I'm short and my cushions on my couch were starting to lose their love, so I figured risers would help and they did. I can get off the couch now with ease! Love 'em!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, gets costly for a U-shaped couch (need 12)
customer_reviews.text: They are sturdy, but we used them on carpet under our couch to raise it enough to be able to slide a hospital type tray under it. At first, it was perfect, but then they settled into the carpet and sunk a little bit, now the couch is just a little too low for the tray to slide under. If you're using them for the same reason, take that into account.
customer_reviews.author: Swellguy

customer_reviews.title: These were delivered quickly and were perfect. My grandson's 1st twin bed was not high ...
customer_reviews.text: These were delivered quickly and were perfect. My grandson's 1st twin bed was not high enough for his toy tote but was too high to add the taller furniture risers because he would not be able to get onto his bed. These gave just enough height to allow the toy tote and he could get on his bed. They are extremely sturdy and work well. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Linda F.

customer_reviews.title: Raises anything two inches.
customer_reviews.text: It can do it all. It can raise your desk two inches. It can raise your bed two inches. I had a short person stand on it and she was raised two inches. Overall I would say it is great at raising things with legs by two inches.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: This was just the perfect height to lift the desk to a proper height
customer_reviews.text: I have an antique desk that I was afraid I was going to have to repurpose because it was too short to find any desk chair to work with it. I was skeptical about these, wondering if they would look really out of place. Surprisingly, they don't! This was just the perfect height to lift the desk to a proper height. Make sure to order these, the kind that have memory foam inside. The foam hugs the legs of the furniture, which keeps it from sliding all over the place.
customer_reviews.author: BookieBeans

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: We got these for our computer desk because our chair arm rests wouldn't fit under it. I was skeptical at first because our desk has wheels on it but we locked them and they stay firmly in place. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: UNSTABLY/FLIMSY - Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Too flimsy so sofa is unstable. Do not waist your money on this product
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I got these to raise my bed just a little, as it is already pretty high because of the thick mattress. The 2 inch risers allow me to put an under-the-bed box for storage.
customer_reviews.author: M. Buck

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Using these for a bench that we wanted raised that has castors on it. I was concerned about the size of them because the pictures made them look very large, I was pleasantly surprised that they were smaller than I had anticipated, which was good. I like the non slip pad that the castors sit on. Over all very pleased with this
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. I think they may be slightly taller than 2 inches. More like 2 1/2 inches, which I actually prefer. I use these to elevate the head of my bed. I used to use them for heartburn relief, but I cured my heartburn (gastric reflux) when I quit eating lactose. I still use these risers to lift the head of my bed because the elevation seems to relieve sinus pressure when I am sleeping. These are sturdy and the non-slip pad on top makes them very stable.
customer_reviews.author: DKPerk75234

customer_reviews.title: Great to raise student desks!!
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my classroom to raise student desks so students can stand. The things are so awesome because they don’t even budge!! The soft padding inside really holds on to the table legs. I feel safe knowing the desk won’t move around or tip. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy P

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: The diameter at the base is about 5 in /13 centimeters, which is quite a bit more than I expected. 10 cm at the top. It would be nice if they included dimensions in the description. Otherwise they work perfectly
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: It's only a 30 day return policy.
customer_reviews.text: Well lets see you get a 30 return policy. I ordered the product on 4/21. I went to use the product for the first time on 5/26 after finally getting my furniture from the furniture store. Two of the four in a set were missing the foam inserts so the couch is not sitting level now. I know its a compliant that might not apply to you but it screws me over. I just want what I paid for but amazon won't do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Watkins

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: My couch sits so low that my Roomba can't get under it..These brought it up plenty. My couch is so heavy it has a queen size bed inside...so far so good...
customer_reviews.author: lucy

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: They do their job. Very solidly constructed and the foam rubber inside the tops molds pretty well and doesn't tear easily; I put the metal feet of a standard metal bed frame in them and later had to pull the bed up and move it, and the foam was still in solid shape...just indented from the pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good value and perfect height to raise furniture
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my 88 year old mom’s couch to make it easier for her to sit and get up from couch. They were the perfect height and super easy ... just lift couch and insert one under each couch leg.
customer_reviews.author: kayk

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Perfect height for my sofa. I have knee problems these help me get up easier from sofa. Color matched perfectly with my living room colors.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These risers are fantastic. We needed risers for a table
customer_reviews.text: These risers are fantastic. We needed risers for a table, and there is a surface inside the riser that grips the leg of the table, and it is positioned inside a bit of a ledge. Makes sense when you see them. They seem larger than necessary, but, they are very stable. I think they were designed well. The table is very stable, the risers are sturdy and the table legs are secure. This is a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Ok at first but do not last
customer_reviews.text: Initially these were great but they do not really last. About a week ago my friend was sitting on my couch when one of them decided to break.
customer_reviews.author: LUKE7

customer_reviews.title: Useful but...
customer_reviews.text: One of the spongy round pads was missing. Seems like there is always something wrong or missing from an order these days. Quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn Robinson

customer_reviews.title: These worked great. I needed to put 3 pieces of furniture ...
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. I needed to put 3 pieces of furniture in a room that would NOT fit and I bought these and raised a table up 2 inches, so it fit OVER my sewing machine desk, and all three pieces of furniture fit awesomely. It was such an awesome find!
customer_reviews.author: Typing4aLiving

customer_reviews.title: Make sure of the leg size
customer_reviews.text: Work great for lifting my lawn chair,needs them taller so I could get in and out ,and they didn’t slip.
customer_reviews.author: janelle hartness

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting furniture high enough for a Roomba to clean under...
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of using stacked cardboard pieces to lift my ottoman high enough for my Roomba to go under - these risers were perfect for the job.
customer_reviews.author: E. Talerico

customer_reviews.title: Not for chair legs
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use these to raise up lawn chairs. Very unstable in that application. Could be good for a bed or more substantial furniture that is not intended to move. I'm guessing on that.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Risers
customer_reviews.text: I like my chair risers they was easy to install very sturdy I put them under a couch.
customer_reviews.author: Doris A Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: These are a bit big, but solid
customer_reviews.text: I like that they are strong, what I didn't like was they have excessive amounts of glue on caps, and the first of the 4 have an advertising sticker that will take some WD40 to wear off the sticker and glue.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Canning

customer_reviews.title: Putting my new media center at the perfect height for my needs...
customer_reviews.text: I invested in an new desktop computer so I needed a bigger desk. I bought a big, wrap-around desk that would accommodate a media center type of set-up. The desk is perfect except that it was too low, so I shopped on Amazon and found these lifters. Now my desk is at the perfect height. These lifters will accommodate up to 2,000 pounds, so I anticipate that they will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Mobley

customer_reviews.title: great product and a good price
customer_reviews.text: these did the trick and fixed our problem of the frame being to short. worked like a charm
customer_reviews.author: melodie loutzenhiser

customer_reviews.title: Secure.
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. The 2 inch height is perfect for my swivel rocker. I had to buy 2 packs because the rocker had 5 extensions. Unlike other brands, the inside has a foam that keeps the leg from sliding within the cup. This is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Works easily
customer_reviews.text: Works great, solved the problem of bed sliding around hardwood floor when we... Moved in the bed.
customer_reviews.author: Mydoglikessalsa

customer_reviews.title: Broke within a week!
customer_reviews.text: Within one week of being installed on a full size bed, the wheel of the bed broke right through on one of the risers. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Christine D.

customer_reviews.title: strength
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for raising a daybed up 2 in so new mattress can fit on trendle. recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris OToole

customer_reviews.title: You Can Stack 2 of Them To make 4 inches.
customer_reviews.text: Worked Great I needed To Raise The Foot of My Bed to releave My Leg Swelling, 2 at first ,then 4. At Last!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Bruner

customer_reviews.title: Perfect extra lift.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. Wish came with 5 for a middle bar but my bed has been holding up easily. Doesn’t move around at all. I needed the slightest light to get a box under there.
customer_reviews.author: AFB

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and sound product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and sound product. The pictures looked like it was approx 1/2 depth but much deeper wich would hold furniture with a longer leg. I could see where this would help but the legs on my lift chair are only about 3/4" deep on a metal frame on it would not work.
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: These are great when you need just a little lift to your bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice. Just tall enough to bring the bed to ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice. Just tall enough to bring the bed to a height where I can easily clean under it, but not so tall that I need a pole vault to get into bed. I also appreciate the little rubber grippers on the bottom, that keep the bed in place.
customer_reviews.author: B. Morin

customer_reviews.title: Not great on carpeted floors.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use these to elevate a heavy metal desk on a carpeted floor. They are not very stable on carpet. Once I got them under the desk, the desk was very wobbly. I removed them since I need a stable surface to work on.
customer_reviews.author: monkeywrench133

customer_reviews.title: Solid Risers that do what they are supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: Have skid proof rubber in cup which was nice. We needed to raise a patio table 2" to get an umbrella to fit due to curved interior legs. It worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra S Collins

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am using these on a Queen bed frame. The frame itself has different size feet but these accommodated all of them without any wobble. Not too tall or too short. I keep an ikea pull out storage box underneath my bed.
customer_reviews.author: BrittanyLaineG

customer_reviews.title: Great for elderly
customer_reviews.text: Ideal for my 94 year old dad 's chair. He can now sit and stand with minimal effort. Didn't even know there was a product for low chairs and the elderly. Thank you for making dads life a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: One of my best buys
customer_reviews.text: These risers were great for my sofa, which has rather small round legs. It's always been too low for me and hard to get up from sitting. These made all the difference. I levered the sofa up and inserted the risers under the legs. I paid $9.26 for them a couple of weeks ago so I guess I got a good deal. Wish I had had them 10 years ago. Excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: MIA

customer_reviews.title: Must buy
customer_reviews.text: They did exactly what I needed and that was to lift my room refrigerator up off the floor some from being so low
customer_reviews.author: Shayla

customer_reviews.title: Basic product, missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. But one of the risers did not have the slip pad that the other 3 did. Because of the height difference that created, had to remove them all. Would expect better quality control...
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly A Sims

customer_reviews.title: Great value great producr
customer_reviews.text: Just what we neeses to raise our bed. Easy to put on, we uaed a car jack to lift the bed to put the risers in place and they fit perfectly
customer_reviews.author: dsferraro

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I have a desk that I needed to raise to be able to sit more comfortably. These risers work well. They are a little larger in diameter than what the picture makes them out to be. The only color available is brown. I wish they came in black to match my desk better.
customer_reviews.author: ansky

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and very useful!
customer_reviews.text: I love these. They are extremely sturdy and well-made. The foam bits make any leg of furniture you stick in feel secure. They also look great against my dark wood floors. It's not like they are invisible, but they are less of an eyesore than expected. I have them raising up a white desk and I am happy I didn't get white to match as the brown just blends in so well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifted my sofa to a more comfortable height for sitting and rising
customer_reviews.text: Lifted my sofa to a more comfortable height for sitting and rising. As you get older your legs get weaker, so this is very useful for seniors. Makes life easy and more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carole, Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They work great
customer_reviews.text: I have had these now for over a month and I am not disappointed. It is just me sleeping on a queen size bed, so I weigh around 145lb. It has helped me create more storage under my bed
customer_reviews.author: B Tomolovski

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, and does not show any give
customer_reviews.text: I uses these for under a chair, that sits too low to use a key board on a table. Large diameter cups allow just about any chair to sit on it. Sturdy, and does not show any give.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog Father

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, used under a swivel rocker, with 5 legs so had to order 2 sets. So far does the job, hasn’t slipped, and I move around a lot in this chair. Up and down and swivel around the cups have stayed put.
customer_reviews.author: Ness

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I needed my vanity raised a few inches. Easy, sturdy and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: MARGO DIXON

customer_reviews.title: They're very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these so our Roomba can fit under our loveseat and couch. They don't slip or scratch the hardwood floor. There's little silicone looking dots on the bottoms.
customer_reviews.author: K. Roth

customer_reviews.title: They work great, just wish there was some non slip material ...
customer_reviews.text: They work great, just wish there was some non slip material on the bottom as they slip on wood floors. I am going to put a piece of under carpet stuff to help with that!
customer_reviews.author: Sally Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Not attractive !
customer_reviews.text: These are not at all what I thought they would be like. They are obnoxiously stout. Your couch will look like a car up on blocks...the feel from on the couch is okay but also how Lounette the clown must feel on the big comfy couch :( Even if your couch has a skirt at the bottom as mine does, these will still be VERY visible. My couch left heavy grooves in them or I would return them as I had to by 2 sets (my couch has 5 legs). Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Case

customer_reviews.title: Risers fit nicely and very sturdy and strong
customer_reviews.text: Did the trick! An inexpensive fix, for a difficult chair to get in and out of! Used under a rocker/recliner. Now seat is 2" higher, and much easier to sit and stand. Risers fit nicely and very sturdy and strong. Does not interfere with the motion or function of the recliner.
customer_reviews.author: francine bush

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Used on two twin beds for 65-lb children. They have held up well and provide enough lift for under-bed storage. Slightly bigger than anticipated, but not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: HTS

customer_reviews.title: Very functional, can use a bedskirt to cover up
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done! They're not the prettiest, but they work very well and seem quite strong despite being made of plastic. I used a long bedskirt to cover them up. Now I have more under-the-bed storage space.
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: BETTER HEIGHT!
customer_reviews.text: For my recliner! I'm 6ft tall and don't like to sit with knees under my chin... This makes getting in and out SOOO much easier!!!
customer_reviews.author: BEARICA

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: We had the 5.5 inch ones but they were too tall. These are much better, although three or even four inch ones would have been good too. Sad we cannot put under the bed boxes though.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great to lift my nightstands off the air vents
customer_reviews.text: Works great to lift my nightstands off the air vents! They may look too big for some nightstands, but mine are chunky. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Mom on the Go

customer_reviews.title: They have worked great. We have them on carpet
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to raise our king size bed a few inches. They have worked great. We have them on carpet, and the bed frame feels very secure, just as if it was directly on the floor. Only glitch was on my part -- forgot typical king size metal bed frames have the two additional supports in the middle, so had to order another set (of 4). I think I saw you could also order sets of 6, and probably could have saved a few dollars had I realized that is what I needed from the beginning. But otherwise, love the risers and would recommend them to others.
customer_reviews.author: jdcbld

product_meta.title: Slipstick CB654 2 Inch Lift Furniture Risers / Bed Risers, Adds 2" Height to Heavy Furniture or Beds (Set of 4) Supports 2,000 lbs
product_meta.description: Do you ever struggle standing up out of furniture that is too low to the floor if so, these low profile 2-inch tall furniture risers are the solution you can't stand to do without! specially developed to boost seat ergonomics by raising low sitting furniture to a safer and more comfortable height level that eases the sit to stand process. Built for strength and durability, a set of 4 of these heavy-duty furniture risers will support 2,000 pounds (500 lbs per riser cup lift). to ensure lifted furniture is safely secured, each riser features a recessed holder cup on top which is padded with a memory foam cushion that firmly locks in furniture legs, bed rollers, and caster wheels 1-1/4” to 3” in diameter. If furniture legs or wheels are smaller than 1-1/4 inch in diameter, we recommend placing our CB654 CB605 caster cup in-between the furniture foot and riser top to disperse the pressure and avoid the risk of puncture. Great for raising Stationary arm chairs, beds, couches, sofas, tables, desks and other heavy 4 legged furniture. Added height also makes cleaning/vacuuming floors under furniture easier - ideal for robot cu to prevent unwanted sliding and protect floor surfaces, risers have 3 tiny round grippers built into their bottom base.
feature_bullets: Raises beds, couches, armchairs, desks, sofas, and other heavy stationary furniture height 2 inches to assist the sit to stand process and boost ergonomics
Adds additional height/storage space under beds and furniture making cleaning underneath furniture easier (great for robot vacuums). Rubber stoppers on the base prevents movement
Lifts heavy bedroom, living room, and home office furniture to a more ergonomically correct height that provides a safer biomechanical advantage to user, Fits Standard 2 inch (50mm) Bed Castor Wheels
Recessed holder cup with memory foam cushion pad built into top of risers securely locks in furniture legs and caster wheels 1.25” to 3” diameter
This 4 pack of heavy-duty floor protecting furniture risers will support 2,000 pounds (500 lb weight capacity per riser cup), Not suitable for legs smaller than 32mm (1- 1/4 inch)

Top recess is 76mm (3″) diameter by 19mm (3/4″) deep. (foam insert 9mm (3/8″) thick) ; Suitable for Square Posts up to 56mm (2-1/4″) ; For Legs smaller than 32mm (1-1/4 inch) use CB605 in-between leg and Bed Riser
